defs: a seeing of a person who has come travelling from a long distance, before entering a house or before having a wash.
to rise into air (as dust).
to smear (on the body) with; to anoint.
a dusty place for playing (as a wrestling arena).
a very small bit; particle; a speck.
fine powdery earth or other matter in bits, fine that can easily fly in air; dust.
any dust-like substance (as pollen of flowers).
to disturb the settled dust; to raise the dust.
to be covered with dust.
ದೂಳುಗೆದರು.
a piece of cloth used to cover a deity preventing it from becoming dirty with dust.
ದೂಳುಪಾವಡದವರು dūḷu pāvaḍadavaru a sub-caste among lingāyats.
to become dust; to be powdered.

to make into powder; to powder; to pulverise.
to accuse of wrong doing; to charge.
to give an account of; to report.
to blame; to accuse; to censure; to find fault with.
to worry (oneself) about; to be anxious.
to cause to worry; to make (another) anxious.
to find fault with; to blame; to reproach; to accuse.
to report evil of another; to utter slander against.
to bring formal charges against (of doing wrong, breaking the law, etc.).
to appeal earnestly for help.
to give an account of; to report; to bring to (another's) notice.
to say pessimistically that some bad or evil thing would happen; to portend a future evil, failure or unfortunate thing.
an accusing or being accused; accusation.
very bad reputation; disgrace; dishonour; infamy.
a requesting for help, sympathy, etc.; an appeal.
a message, report or news.
an order; a command.
anxious concern; worry; anxiety.
pain; suffering; distress; anguish.

a complainant; an appellant.

a man who accuses, blames.

the inside of the eye.

strong; robust; sturdy.

ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಕೊಡು dřṣṭi koḍu to consider or ponder over (something); 2. (fig.) to change another's view point (for better); to reveal new vistas; to enlighten; ದೃಷ್ಟಿಗೆ ಬೀಳು dřṣṭige bīḷu to be seen; to appear; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಚುಕ್ಕೆ dřṣṭi cukke = ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಬೊಟ್ಟು; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತಗಲು dřṣṭi tagalu (an evil look) to affect maliciously; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತಪ್ಪಿಸು dřṣṭi tappisu to avoid being seen; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತಾಗು dřṣṭi tāgu = ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತಗಲು; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತೆಗೆ dřṣṭi tege to remove (by waving a burning object, salt, etc.) the evil effects of the malicious look of another; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ನಿವಾಳಿಸು dřṣṭi nivāḷisu to wave a burning object, salt, etc. before a person affected by the malicious look of another with a view to warding of the evil; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಬಡಿ dřṣṭi baḍi = ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತಗಲು; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಬಟ್ಟು dřṣṭi baṭṭu = ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಬೊಟ್ಟು; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಬೀಳು dřṣṭi bīḷu (one's glance) to fall on (something); ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಬೊಟ್ಟು dřṣṭi botṭu a small, round, black mark made usu. on the cheek or chin, with a view to avoiding the evil effects of another's look; ದೃಷ್ಟಿಯಾಗು dřṣṭiyāgu = ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ತಗಲು; ದೃಷ್ಟಿಯಾರೆ dřṣṭiyāre (used as an adverb) to the full satisfaction of one's eyes; ದೃಷ್ಟಿಯಿಡು dřṣṭiyiḍu to watch carefully; ದೃಷ್ಟಿಯೆತ್ತು dřṣṭiyettu = ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ನಿವಾಳಿಸು; ದೃಷ್ಟಿ ಹರಿಸು dřṣṭi harisu to turn one's eyes on; to look at.
= ದೃಷ್ಟಿಕೋನ.
the angle from which a thing is seen.
the orientation of the mind in analysing (something).
that can be or is seen.
perceptible by the eyes.
a donation of one's eyes (to a blind person).
(fig.) a revealing of a new and better viewpoint.
a defect in one's vision, as long-sight or short-sight.

an eye-disease characterised by continuous discharge of rheum or other watery product from the mucous membranes of the eyes.

the innermost coat of the posterior part of the eyeball that receives the image produced by the lens, is continuous with the optic nerve, and consists of several layers, one of which contains the rods and cones that are sensitive to light; the retina.

the power of the eye in perceiving objects.
the act of seeing; sight.
a thin white layer formed on the black portion of the eye-ball, that blurs the sight.

anger expressed by one's fierce look.
the range of one's sight.

its effect.

a blind man.
